ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take it if you're interested in the subject matter, for sure.

If you have any interest in learning about what Judaism is and how it has evolved and remained the same, either as a Jewish or non-Jewish individual, you should absolutely take this course. You won't regret it. The workload is quite manageable and the lectures amazing.
Great class. You learn a lot. The professor is smart, eloquent and nice. The material is really interesting. Relevant stuff.
Great class. Take it if you're Jewish and want an academic look at your history.
Fascinating material, light workload. Totally awesome if you're interested in Jewish history, no matter your religion.
Great way to learn about the in-depth history of the Jewish people (not just Judaism). Sunday school in one semester

This is a great class that will teach you a great deal of information about the religious history of Judaism. Professor Hayes is brilliant and so warm and approachable. The work is totally manageable and the tests are not difficult if you study appropriately (which is pretty simple to do). If you come from a Jewish day school background or have already studied Jewish history in depth, much of the material will be repetitive. That said, I learned a lot of new information and gained a complex perspective on broad themes across time. Take the course!
